title: Episode 347 - Back to the Future with Zero Knowledge

rawLines.text: [Music]
welcome to zero knowledge I'm your host
Anna Rose in this podcast we will be
exploring the latest in zero knowledge
research and the decentralized web as
well as new paradigms that promise to
change the way we interact and transact
[Music]
online this week I share a story that
I've been meaning to tell on the air for
a long time it's a story about
coincidences involving this show and the
name zero knowledge and I feel like it's
a really good time to share with you
this is also kind of officially my first
episode back after our three-month
Hiatus I have really missed doing this
part of my job I feel a little bit out
of the loop but also more clear-headed
like very ready to Adventure into a new
frontier things are changing now now so
fast it's going to be hard to keep up
but hopefully at least in our little ZK
corner of the world we're going to be
able to map out what's happening this
particular episode will be quite
different from our usual interviews it's
just going to be me talking to you next
week I'll be rejoined by Nico and some
guests in a more familiar format but I
thought as a return episode I would try
something a little bit different before
I jump into this I just wanted to share
a couple updates from the ZK podast
podcast so first off we have a new
website and a new jingle it was time for
a refresher and I'm excited to see our
visuals and audio evolving a bit
obviously change is always a bit jarring
at first but I also think it's good it
helps to demarcate a moment in time
maybe something that helps prompt a new
Direction next up I have the
announcement for ZK Summit 13 it's
taking place on May 12th in Toronto the
application to attend just
space is more limited than normal this
time around our venue caps out at around
400 so we are encouraging folks who
really want to join to get their spot
secured early it's invite only and we
will be prioritizing previous attendees
and long-term members of the ZK
Community if you are newer and really
want to join just aim to get your
application in early for a better chance
of getting a spot the application to
speak is also open this is part of the
same application and that will remain
open until March 15th for more info
check out ZK summit.com we've also added
the link in the show notes lastly as I
mentioned in a little bonus episode two
weeks ago the ZK podcast company is
hiring we are currently looking to fill
two roles a Content marketing manager
and a strategic growth lead if you want
to listen to that bonus to get a good
sense for what we're looking for please
do and if you think you could be a good
candidate please send an application all
right that covers our updates so on to
the story I want want to
tell to start I do need to talk a little
bit about how this podcast got its name
and you have heard the story before I've
shared it many times my old co-host
Frederick and I when we started we had
no name it was just called this podcast
until episode 11 when we decided on the
name zero knowledge so we knew at the
highest level what zero knowledge was we
knew about zcash and we noticed that
every time you'd mention zero knowledge
to a Smart engineer it would spark some
genuine excitement and curiosity from
them so that was a good sign but really
we ourselves were not involved in ZK
research when we took that name back in
2018 but as more and more zero knowledge
research came out and the space grew so
too did our knowledge about the topic as
well as our connection to it and so the
zero knowledge podcast kind of
manifested to actually be become the
zero knowledge podcast and from there I
went on to run the event series ZK
Summit which I mentioned earlier I
started the ZK hack project and all of
the projects that came out of there like
the ZK whiteboard sessions ZK mesh all
of this work has been centered around
zero knowledge and the applications that
it enables and as many of you know I
have no background as a cryptographer or
an engineer I've worked over the years
in music video games and eventually in
Tech but how and why I ended up working
exclusively on ZK has seemed like a
fluke but was it so that was a bit of
the backstory I needed to share before
we could jump in to the story I really
want to tell you in the summer of 2023
when the show was about 5 years old I
started to explore trademarks for the
show and logo and so I did a search for
the US trademark for zero knowledge I
found a bunch of teams in our community
teams we know today that had the name on
their application
but there was a batch of older
trademarks for zero knowledge that
caught my eye these were from the late
'90s and early 2000s and some of them
were registered by a company called zero
knowledge systems so I switched my
search on the trademark website to zero
knowledge systems to learn a bit more
about them the first result that came up
was zks which they applied to trademark
in 2001 and I was so curious like who
are these guys you can't find that much
out from trademark applications you can
find out like which lawyer they used and
something about the types of businesses
they run but you can find out where the
company is located so I checked for the
address of zero knowledge systems and
when I saw it my heart kind of
flipped this company was registered in
Montreal
Canada that's my
hometown but not just that the company
was registered on sor
Boulevard if you haven't been to
Montreal let me give you a sense for the
street it's a Street full of bars and
restaurants and shops most of the
buildings have three stories the facades
are made of brick around the year 2000 I
spent like 95% of my free time on that
street I was a student but I was also a
bit of a scener I spent a lot of time
probably too much time hanging out in
bars talking to people in bars I worked
in a bar I definitely was drinking too
much in bars and singal Boulevard was my
spot I know that being a bar person has
a pretty negative connotation today you
imagine it being Sleazy and sad and
there are a lot of bars like that but
our scene was way more fun and it was
like a special time in those years on
that street to be honest the web 3 scene
at conferences and meetups remind me so
much of that time there were the stars
the critics the slightly IAL ogs the
shiny eyed newbies people today arguing
over l1s or l2s or why some tech is more
sophisticated why some ecosystem is more
authentic it reminds me of back then
when we argued over which genre of music
was more sophisticated complicated
authentic or underground and then like
now these conversations were often an
entry point to learn more generally
about someone their motivation their
background and maybe get inspired by
some new insight or perspective they
could share with
you coming back to these trademarks
according to what I've was seen zero
knowledge systems was located somewhere
on Salen Boulevard from the years 1998
to at least 2001 I had spent a lot of
time on that street but I was mainly in
like an eight block stretch of it so I
was curious where on the street was this
place I have not lived in Montreal for
over 15 years so I couldn't exactly
place the address just by looking at it
so I jumped on maps and typed in 3981
soron
Boulevard W no freaking
way I could not believe it zero
knowledge systems in the year 2000 seem
to have been located directly across the
street and I mean directly across the
street from my favorite bar like the bar
I basically lived at during that time
today the bar still exists it's called
Barbarosa back then it was called
blizzards it held maybe 50 60 people
standing and I was a regular I was
probably there like two to three times a
week if you were working nearby and you
needed a good spot to hang out blizzards
would have been a good option especially
in the summer when the big windows out
front opened right onto s ra the crowd
at this place was about 10 years older
than I was and there were tons of
working professionals coming by after a
long day of work looking at this on the
map I started to think think like did
the employees of zero knowledge systems
also go to blizzards after work did they
hang out there did I meet people back
then from a company called zero
knowledge systems did I hear them
talking about all of this stuff did
someone maybe explain to me what that
name meant even back
then what an insane coincidence that 15
years later I randomly stumble on the
same name and decide to name my podcast
that name zero
knowledge so this in itself is already
pretty cool I have told this story many
times for some of you listening you may
have heard me tell this story it's one
of the weirdest coincidences I've ever
experienced it feels almost eerie and I
have told this story a lot but this
story actually continues back in April
last year a day or two after ZK Summit
11 I was in Athens and I was with a big
group at dinner I was telling everyone
about zero knowledge systems and my
proximity to it one of the guys at the
table was like oh whoa you hung out
across the street from zero knowledge
systems that company was legendary do
you know who worked there and I was like
not really and he was like well a bunch
of the early bitcoiners went through
there he told me that there were only a
couple of companies working on digital
currencies back in the late 90s and one
of these was Zero knowledge
systems now this is long before Bitcoin
a this is
2000 but it seems like not only did zero
knowledge systems have the name for the
niche cryptography we talk about on this
show but it also may have been an
important contributor to the ideas and
research that led to bitcoin and to the
blockchain ecosystem as we know it
today that night when I got home I
started to dig around the Wikipedia page
for zero knowledge systems is actually
kind of crazy I had looked at it when
IID found the trademark but I had been
trying to figure out about the company
itself I hadn't looked that closely at
the people who worked there now I was
looking here are some of them Adam back
Mike shaver Ian
Goldberg the founders Austin Hill and
some of the people working there later
went on to found blockstream in 2014 but
on the Wikipedia page it actually
doesn't mention digital
currencies these folks were definitely
close to the people working on these
topics at their earliest Inception but
it's tough to actually find out that
much on this company most of the links
are now dead or squatted on by random
crypto
companies soon after this I was
introduced to someone who actually
worked at zero knowledge systems his
name is Jonathan and he's someone I hop
to invite back on the show to ask him
more about what it was like to work at
zero knowledge systems what were some of
the ideas being floated around at the
time but also what he's worked on since
cuz it's pretty interesting as well
before I recorded this episode I did
want to check a few things so I jumped
on a call with him to ask a few of these
questions my first question was whether
or not zero knowledge systems actually
worked on digital payments since this
wasn't clear from the Wikipedia page he
told me that yes they had done some work
on this implementing an early chamian
digital currency but nothing that really
took off they were more well known for a
project called Freedom which was similar
to what later became
tour I asked him what happened to them
he said the company started off as very
edgy it made waves in the Montreal Tech
scene zero knowledge systems also helped
to highlight the need for privacy on the
internet long before Snowden did but at
some point they stopped working on
freedom they pivoted to something safer
the company renamed to radial point and
was eventually sold now the last
question and maybe the one that was most
important to me was the office for zero
knowledge systems actually on sailon
Boulevard like because I thought maybe
this was just a PO box or the address
for the administration but the office
was somewhere else but Jonathan did
confirm that it was indeed on sale and
ra at that time that there were about a
hundred people working there around 2001
they did moved to a larger location more
downtown but in the year 2000 or so they
would have been on Saleem r
and here's a little bonus he told me
that there had been a giant red sign
with their logo that read zero knowledge
on the building on
Saron so I very well probably saw that
sign every time I walked out or stumbled
out of that
bar I want to see if I can dig up
pictures from the window of the bar
looking out it would be so cool if I
could find
this so yeah this has obviously got me
out asking is this why I was so Keen to
pick the name zero knowledge has it been
wedged into my psyche for like 15 years
it's so
wild there are so many other questions
too like who were all the people working
there Beyond those listed on the
Wikipedia page what did those people go
on to do what was Freedom all about how
was it built how far did they get with
it and why did they make the decision to
stop did they actually work on ZK Tech
itself or was it just their namesake I
mean I don't think ZK was very usable at
that time but what did they even imagine
ZK would be used for in the future and
last but not least I would love to know
if anyone from zero knowledge systems
ever went across the street to hang out
at a bar called blizzards in the Years
2000 or 2001 that would be so
interesting to know to me this feels a
bit like the start of a story because I
think it is I'm going to be doing a bit
of a side quest this year to learn more
about zero knowledge systems this sort
of Oddball Montreal tech company from
the year 2000 I'm going to try to get
Jonathan and some other folks who work
there on the show to help me better
understand what it was like working on
this kind of Technology back then and
there is a bit of a call out here if you
worked at zero knowledge systems or know
someone who did and you think you have a
little piece of info that could add to
this story get in touch you can send us
an email at hello zeron knowledge. FM
next week we start back with new
interviews with teams doing amazing
things in ZK today over the next few
months we will be covering Quantum
Computing AI lates and all sorts of
great topics around ZK and applications
and once again I am so excited to be
back I want to say thank you to the
podcast team Rachel Henrik and Tanya and
to our listeners thanks for listening
[Music]
